intro: Mammillaria zephyranthoides, commonly known as the Zephyranthus mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and is covered in small, white to pale green tubercles. The plant produces pale yellow flowers during the summer months, which are often followed by red fruits. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in rock gardens.
